articles.description: Follow build-up and get team news before Liverpool host Manchester City in a huge game in the Premier League title race.
articles.title: Premier League: Liverpool v Man City - build-up as title rivals set to meet

articles.description: Watch BBC One coverage and follow radio and text commentary as Wales seek a first win of the 2024 Six Nations.
articles.title: Six Nations: Wales v France - watch, listen & text

articles.description: Watch live coverage and follow text updates as Everton host Chelsea in the Women's FA Cup quarter-finals, before Tottenham entertain Man City.
articles.title: Women's FA Cup: Build-up as Everton host holders Chelsea

articles.description: France overpower winless Wales in an eight-try Six Nations thriller in Cardiff with Warren Gatland's side remaining bottom of the table.
articles.title: France overpower Wales in Six Nations thriller

articles.description: Tottenham boost their hopes of a top-four Premier League finish with an emphatic victory over 10-man Aston Villa at Villa Park.
articles.title: Spurs boost top-four hopes as they romp to win at 10-man Villa

articles.description: Listen to Sportsound commentary and follow live text updates as Celtic host Livingston before Hibernian welcome Rangers in the Scottish Cup quarter-finals.
articles.title: Scottish Cup quarter-finals: Maeda restores Celtic's lead after Livingston calamity

articles.description: Follow live updates of all four of Sunday's Women's Scottish Cup quarter-finals, including Hibernian v Rangers.
articles.title: Women's Scottish Cup quarter-finals - follow live updates

articles.description: If England's jersey was weighing heavy against Scotland, it was wafer thing against Ireland in their statement victory, writes Matt Dawson.
articles.title: 'Twickenham was jumping because of how England were playing'

articles.description: Paris St-Germain are held to a 2-2 draw by Reims at the Parc des Princes as Kylian Mbappe starts on the bench.
articles.title: Mbappe dropped as PSG draw with Reims

articles.description: England have been "exposed" in India and have some "deep thinking" ahead, according to coach Brendon McCullum.
articles.title: 'Exposed' England have 'thinking' to do - McCullum
